body.paragraph: A while loop consists of two parts: (a) the repeating condition, and (b) the body of the loop. The body of the loop (indented statements below the while loop) will repeatedly be executed as long as the condition is true and will stop immediately when it becomes False.

body.example:
i = 0
while i < 10:
	print(i)
	i = i + 1

tooltip.title: Repeatedly Run Indented Code
tooltip.body: Repeatedly executes the indented code below the while loop as long as the condition is True.
